snippet.title: Swift: Facebook News Feed - Dynamic Cell Content
snippet.description:
Make sure to watch the first two parts of this series, otherwise this tutorial won't make much sense :)
Part 1: https://youtu.be/NJxb7EKXF3U
Part 2: https://youtu.be/ZwBYQpLQAvw

In today's tutorial, we'll look at how to support dynamic cell content within our UICollectionView.  We'll first create a Post class to hold all the individual information for our cells. Then we'll move onto changing our vertical constraints to support varying text lengths in each Post object.  

By the end of the tutorial, you'll have learned how to dynamically change all the elements in the list as you scroll up and down to your heart's content.

Completed project:
https://www.letsbuildthatapp.com/course/Facebook-News-Feed

Starter project:
https://github.com/purelyswift/facebook_feed

If you like the video, make sure to hit that like button and subscribe :) It goes a long way to support the work that goes into putting the channel together.
